resources.string:
Welcome to Thailand, the Land of Smiles.
 
We will be going on an adventure to Pattaya City, located in the Chonburi Province south of Bangkok. 
 
So buckle up it's going to be a wild ride, or something like that.
ยินดีต้อนรับ

The Adult Fun section is information on Pattaya\'s sex industry. This may not be for everyone. So, if you\'re homophobic or just a frigid person in general you might want to avoid this section. Otherwise ENJOY!!!

Suvarnabuhmi is Thailands biggest and main airport. It is located on the south end of Bangkok going towards Pattaya, which is convenient for our purpose. 

 I have never had any issues coming through any of the airports on the list. If you have your arrival card filled out in advance, then you should not have any problems. Customs is also a breeze, if you aren't an idiot. 

What I really like about Suvarnabuhmi is that all transportation is easy to get to. For taxis and buses, just go down to level 1 from the arrivals level (level 2), and there they are. 
I don't know a whole lot about the other airports because I never took a taxi or a bus from either one. However, the buses and taxis are pretty much the same everywhere in Thailand.

From level 1 you can get a taxi to Pattaya or the Ekamai Bus Terminal. There are taxis, vip limos and vans to choose from. It all depends on your budget. \n\nIt all depends on what kind of time you have and what your budget is. A taxi to Pattaya from Suvarnabuhmi will cost about 1,500 baht. One from Don Mueang will cost about 2,000 baht. and one from Utapao will cost around 1,000 baht.

You can also go down one more level and take the train into Bangkok then get off at the end of the line (Phayatai Station), get on the Sky Train. Take the Sky Train to Ekamai and there's the bus station. 

The bus from the airport is about 160 baht I think, but they don't run 24 hours. 

The Ekamai way by using the airport train and Sky Train will cost about 250 baht total, however, this is the slowest route and the last bus is at 10 or 11 p.m.

There's a lot of shopping in and around Pattaya. We have so many malls and markets, you can find pretty much anything you are looking for. Not just the malls, but there are tons of little shops that have different items in them. 

The markets are everywhere, depending on what day it is. There are several day markets and then you have the night ones. 

Thepprasit is probably the biggest and well known night markets. It is open on Thursday through Sunday. 

The malls are open everyday. Of course, nothing really opens here until 10 or 11 in the morning, so make sure to check the times. 

In the malls the stores are name brand and of good quality just like anywhere else in the world. Of course, the same cannot be said for the smaller shops and markets. You get what you pay for. 

We also have a lot of grocery stores in case you are staying for a long time. We have a great bulk item store Makro. 

Enjoy shopping!!
The Avenue has some small shops, a gym and a very well stocked grocery store Villa Market mainly catering to foreigners with foreign food.
Big C Extra is comparable to a Walmart super store. They have food and other things. There is also a hardware store like Home Depot, food court and restaurants.
Central is the biggest mall in Pattaya at this time. It has six floors with brand name, high end shopping, a bowling alley, awesome movie theatre, two floors of restaurants, a food court, banks.
Central Center has a Big C similar to Big C Extra. It has just received a makeover, and is improved. It has a movie theatre, resuarants, and stores. The Hilton sits on top of the mall.

The Floating Market is outside of town going towards Rayong. It is a big tourist attraction as it hosts local made crafts and souvenirs. Plenty of resaurants too. Sometimes it\'s a bit crowded with all the bus tours.

Harbor Pattaya is finally something for kids. It has some shopping, resaurants, a food court. The biggest attractions are for kids. They have Harbor Land which is a big soft play area, ice skating, wall climbing, snow land, roller land, trampoline jumping, an arcade, different schools. It was a long time coming, we needed it.
Mike\'s has been around for a long time. It has some outlet type shopping. Mostly tourist stuff inside. It\'s like four floors of shopping, a few places to eat. That\'s about it.
A huge area with tourist trinkets.
The night market on Thepprasit is a big and crowded place. It has very good deals on clothes. There is a whole section for food, which is very good. It\'s crowded but worth the trip.
The Outlet Mall is next to the night market. The mall has great deals on brand name clothes, shoes and some other stuff.
Royal Garden Mall is one of the oldest malls here. It has a movie theatre, resuarants, shopping, and Ripley\'s. I stayed here when it was Royal Garden hotel in \'85. Hehehe
Our soon to be newest mall. It will have plenty of shopping. Not sure what else will be in there.

Tukcom or IT City is where you go for all your IT needs. It has everything you could need. Banks, phones, lots of phones, computers, cctv cameras. There is a floor for gaming, videos, music and software for very cheap. You can get Xbox360 games for 100 baht.

There are hundreds of hotels and rooms available in Pattaya. They all offer amenities that you would expect from other hotel in the world. Thais are very service oriented people and take great pride in providing the best quality of customer care. 

There are five star hotels and cheap rooms. It all depends on what you want to do and what you are here for. Pretty much all mid-range rooms offer great amenities, like a pool, safe in the room to mention a few. Also most hotels have safety deposit boxes available at the front desk. 

I use Agoda.com to book all of my rooms. I have found that you can usually add a star to most of the rooms they have listed. I have yet to have a bad time or a bad room using Agoda. 

Tip: If you are nice to the staff and ask questions and not demand, you will get better service and upgrades. I worked in the hotel industry, and it's easy to give someone that "attitude" room that overlooks the garbage cans. 

Here are a few hotels that are available. All of these are close to the beach or on the beach and in the middle of the excitement. 

Not to worry if you don't make a reservation, there are plenty of rooms for walk-ins.

There’s a lot of activities for families to do in and around Pattaya. We have indoor and outdoor activities the whole family can enjoy. There's something for everyone in the family, from water parks to elephant rides. Pattaya and the Chonburi province have some of the most interesting and unique attractions for families to visit. 

There is always something going on in Pattaya. There are a couple marathons during the year, a huge music festival and fireworks competition held every year. Not to mention our Songkran Festival runs after the rest of the country and is very popular with locals and tourists alike. 

In addition to the mainland tourist attractions, there are 10 islands not to be missed: 
Koh Larn (Coral Island) 
Koh Phai 
Koh Si Chang 
Koh Samet 
Koh Sak 
Koh Rin 
Koh Krok 
Koh Talu 
Koh Khram 
and Koh Klet Kaew (The Monkey Island) 

So no matter what you want to do, I'm sure there is something here for the whole family to enjoy.
Inside Harbor Mall on Central Pattaya

Cartoon Network Amazone is centered around the Cartoon Network with it\'s characters. The water park is nice and there are a lot of slides there. The kids area is nice and big, good for little kids. It is a little pricey though. It\'s an all day event.
Elephant Village is a nice place to visit. It is also an elephant sanctuary. Go visit their web site. It is something you don\'t want to miss.
The go carts are good fun. Of course, it is for the older kids and not really the young ones. There are more than one go cart track here so it\'s not boring with the same track.

Harbor Pattaya is a great place for kids of all ages. It\'s right in town and very accessible. They have ice skating, roller skating, wall climbing, trampolines and of course the big padded Harbor Land. It was great to see it open, there wasn\'t much for kids before.

The Khao Kheow open zoo is great fun. This is a little ways from Pattaya, but it\'s worth the trip. It\'s an open zoo, so you have to drive around or walk a lot. Don\'t worry, there is transportation available in the zoo. It\' an all day event.

Nong Nooch Gardens is a fun place to go. They have different shows and you can ride an elephant there if you want to. There are several tours going there, or you can go on your own. It\'s an all day event.

Parasailing is all over the beach. You just have to go out to the beach in the morning and you\'ll see all the people waiting to take you out to parasail. You can see several people doing it from the beach every morning. It\'s n early morning thing. It\'s in town and close to convenient.

Rmanyana is the newest water park in Thailand. It is big and has a lot of slides. It is a little journey from town though. But not to worry there are plenty of cars and buses going out there. It is in the Silver Lake area which has the Big Golden Buddha on the mountain, a winery and other stuff. This is an all day event.

The Sanctuary of Truth is a wonderful temple. This was and is still being built all by hand. There are several craftsmen working on different projects. They do not use any power tools to carve the pieces and they are all joined together with special cuts and workmanship. No power tools an no nails used in the construction. This is a must see. It\'s in town so it\'s close.
The Sriracha Tiger Zoo is a nice place. They have several shows with tigers, elephants and crocodiles. It\'s a pretty big park, so a lot of walking. This is also an all day event.

Let's be honest. Sex sells, everything from candy to cars. 

This will be a journey through Pattaya's thriving adult entertainment playground. 

Get ready to be offended or learn something new about yourself. As the girls say, "You never know if you never try." 

A few things you need to think about before we begin. This is Thailand, not your country. So, what's acceptable here may not be acceptable there and vice versa. Most foreigners don't understand Asia and Asian culture until you've experienced it first hand. Sex is a business for them and they treat it that way. 

Ladyboys - Let's talk about Thailand's third gender: Ladyboys. Ladyboys can be found in every facet of Thai society. 

A Ladyboy is a transexual male who is either pre-op or post-op, it doesn't matter, they are still referred to as she or her. 
It's not always easy to tell a Ladyboy from a Girl-Girl. If she's too beautiful, then she's probably a Ladyboy. 

Walking Street - Walking street is one of the biggest attractions in Pattaya. It's located at the south end of Beach Rd., and is closed to vehicle traffic at 7 p.m. every night because it comes alive at night. 

It has go-go bars, discos, restaurants, hotels and everything else you may be looking for. 

Of course if you're really feeling dirty, you can always go get a soapy massage. 

"The bars are temples but the pearls 
ain't free - You'll find a god in every golden cloister - And if you're lucky then the god's a she - I can feel an angel sliding up to me" 
One Night in Bangkok - Murray Head.

There are a lot of girl-girl bars as well as a number of Ladyboy bars. Typically, the girls working here are \"Farm Fresh\" and still have mud between their toes. They are still learning. Then they will go over to another Soi, a Beer Garden or Walking Street. This is known as a short time Soi and most bars have rooms upstairs.
General Soi. They have open air beer bars, some go-go bars.
This has a lot of gay bars as well as straight bars for the ladies.

This is the major tourist area. There is something for everyone\'s taste. You can find go-go bars, discos, Ladyboys, girls, foreign girls, gay men, lesbians, couples, groups. Pretty much whatever you\'re looking for and can afford, you can find it here.

The Penthouse is a boutique hotel that caters to all. It exists so you can live out your greatest desires or fantasies. It sits across from Boyz Town and just down the street from Walking Street. This hotel has a joiner fee, but only after the first two people. This means you can bring back two people, any gender and there is no charge, if you bring three, there is a 500 baht charge for the third person and so on. It\'s an awesome hotel. It has a cave design, and very sound proof, you don\'t hear any of your neighbors. \n
